availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hugh D. Smyth, Sr. (Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Nancy Smyth. Father of Nancy Smyth, Hugh D. Smyth, Jr., Elitha Ann Smyth, James Smyth, Ritchey Smyth, Jane Smyth, John Smyth, Augustus Smyth, and Joseph Smyth. Farmer in Ballard County in 1850 and 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 300. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville, p. 149. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville District, p. 19. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville, p. 47.
